page.title: 03Principal Features (contd)
page.content: Nowadays, the dams are still maintained and there is a pumping station delivering water to the high areas of Sheffield. Blackbrook Wood occupies the southern side of the Rivelin Valley, an area of deciduous oak, ash, silver birch and alder, clinging to very steep hillside at the top of whichthe underlying millstone grit breaks surface providing near vertical outcrops between 10 and 30 feet in height and much utilised by local rock climbing fraternity. Progressing south from the crags, you come to Hallamshire Golf Club, occupying a site of over a square kilometre. It is an 18-hole course with impressive club-house and facilities and provides employment for 15 people, on a full-time basis.
